note: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is reading What to Expect When You’re Expecting as Rachel enters from her bedroom.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach listen, did you know that during pregnancy your fingers swell up to twice their size and never go back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my…God! Let me see that! (Grabs the book from him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You fall for it every time!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I brought you my old maternity clothes! (Sets a bag on the counter.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Pheebs that’s so sweet—(Grabs a pair of pants)—Ooh, those are so cute!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! And look, (Grabs the pants) see how they expand as the baby grows? (There’s a stretchy part in front.) And then after the baby’s born, they’re great for shoplifting melons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good you’re all here. Thanksgiving tomorrow, four o’clock. (To Rachel) Oh, guess who I invited. Remember that guy Will Colbert from high school?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He was in Ross’s class…marching band…kinda overweight? Well, really overweight. I mean I was his thin friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I don’t remember him. Honey, are you sure you’re not talking about your imaginary boyfriend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No that was Jarred! Wow! I haven’t thought about him in a long time… (Stares off into the distance lost in thought.) (Pause) Anyway, umm Will’s, Will’s here on business and he didn’t have a place to go so I invited him here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, and by the way, he’s lost a bunch of weight. I mean he looks goo-ood! Okay, I mean really , really gorgeous! (Joey clears his throat.) I still love Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just want you to say it once in a while.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right okay, just so you know, I’m not gonna make a turkey this year.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well Phoebe doesn’t eat turkey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Turkey’s are beautiful, intelligent animals!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No they’re not! They’re ugly and stupid and delicious!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right! Okay, it’s just Phoebe. Will’s still on a diet, Chandler doesn’t eat Thanksgiving food, and Rachel’s having her aversion to poultry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She is?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remember I had to leave the room the other day when you had that roast chicken?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. But I thought that was because I put the whole thing on my hand and made it walk across the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway, it just doesn’t seem worth it to make a whole turkey for just three people. Okay? It’s a lot of work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you gotta have turkey on Thanksgiving! I mean, Thanksgiving with no turkey is like-like Fourth of July with no apple pie! Or Friday with no two pizzas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right fine! If it means that much to you! But just—there’s gonna be a ton left over.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No there won’t! I promise I will finish that turkey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, you’re telling me you can eat an entire turkey in just one sitting?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right! ‘Cause I’m a Tribbiani! (To Rachel) And this is what we do! I mean we may not be great thinkers or world leaders, we don’t read a lot or run very fast, but damnit! We can eat!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is watching football, and it’s actually the right game Green Bay at Detroit (although not this year’s), as Monica is getting everything ready.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, isn’t weird to think about how next year at this time they’ll be a little baby at the table? (Chandler turns around in horror.) (Seeing him) Rachel’s! But good to know where you’re at!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Anything I can do to help?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Actually there is. Chandler usually helps me with this, but he’s really into the game so I don’t want to bother him. Could you help me fold these napkins? (Hands her a stack of them.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna go across the hall to check on the yams.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (She starts folding the napkins in half.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No! No! No sweetie! No! Not like that! We’re not at a barn dance. You’ve gotta—you wanna fold them like swans. Like I showed you at Christmas time, remember?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it all just came screaming back to me. (Monica exits.) (To Chandler) So how’s the game?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have no idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! I’m just pretending to watch the game so I don’t have to help out with stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t believe you! That is…brilliant! And Monica has no idea?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope! Every once and a while I just scream stuff at the TV.
(Monica enters and Chandler screams stuff at the TV.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is your team winning hon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! Anderson just scored again! (To Phoebe) There’s no Anderson.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I want to get in on this. Hey Mon? I don’t think I can help you after all, I didn’t realize this game was on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I didn’t know you liked football.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well normally I don’t, but y’know…(looks at the TV)…Green Bay is playing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You like Green Bay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well it’s only like my favorite bay! {Actually, it’s not bad. It just gets a little cold in winter, but in Wisconsin winter only lasts from August to June. :-) }
(Phoebe joins Chandler on the couch as there is a knock on the door which Monica answers.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Hey!

(Oh, I should point out that the live studio audience at this point goes absolutely wild. And I had absolutely no idea that this Will character was that popular! Maybe they should make him the seventh friend. Which would work out just fine since he’s already married to one of them. Will is played by some guy named Brad Pitt, I guess he’s some sort of actor.)

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww thanks! God Will I’m so glad that you came! You look great! You must’ve lost like…

content.speaker: Will
content.text: 150 pounds. Yeah, I’m gonna be in one of those Subway sandwich commercials.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A pie! (Will brought a pie.)

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh right. All right, it’s no fat, it’s no sugar, it’s no dairy…it’s no good. Throw it out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna meet some people? This is uh; this is my husband Chandler. Chandler, this is Will.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey. I’d shake your hand but uh; I’m really into the game. Plus, I think it’d be better for my ego if we didn’t stand right next to each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. (Turns back around.) Wow! (Looks up.) Well done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wanna give me a hand?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Sure! Monica, I can’t get over how great you look! You look stunning!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well you look incredible too! You’re just—you’re so fit!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m watching the game, but I’m not deaf!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh umm, I meant to tell you, Ross is coming.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Ross is coming. Great! I love Ross!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good. And Rachel Green too. (Will stops suddenly.)

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is there a problem?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Nope. Uh, it’s okay. It’s just uh, God I hated her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yeah, I hated her. She was horrible to me in high school. But hey, it was a long time ago, I’m in a good place, it might be actually fun to see her again. You got any cakes or cookies or something? (Starts looking.) No Will no!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, it’s been a while since we’ve screamed something. Maybe we should.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Noooo!! Damn you ref! You burn in hell!!!
(Joey enters eating potato chips.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, what are you doing? You gotta save room, you’ve got almost an entire turkey to eat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let me explain to you how the human body works. I have to warm my stomach first. Eatin’ chips is like stretching.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry, Tribbianis never get full.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: I actually know what you’re talking about. I’m here to tell you something my friend, you can eat and eat and eat but nothing will ever fill that void.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who the hell is this guy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Will! From high school.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey you came! Man you look incredible! Hot stuff! (They hug and Ross realizes what he said.) Hot stuff?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: It’s good to see you man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you too. Man, so-so what are you up to?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: I’m a commodities broker.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? Yeah that-that sounds interesting.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yeah, it’s not. But I’m rich and thin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Man I don’t think I’ve seen you since uh, Lance Davis’ graduation party.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: That was such a fun night!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. It would’ve been good if we had gotten in, but still real fun.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: God we were lame back then. Do you remember how into dinosaurs we were?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: So what do you, what do you do now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So how long are you in town?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey sweetie. Oh good. (Takes the baking dish from her.)

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Rachel Green.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw—oh, that’s right. Are-are you gonna be okay?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh, I’ll-I’ll be fine. Just God I hate her Ross! I hate her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will, high school was-was a long time ago.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Look at her standing there with those yams! My two greatest enemies Ross: Rachel Green and complex carbohydrates.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God Monica, who is that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Will from high school!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I do not remember him! Wow! He’s really got that sexy, smoldering thing going on. (We see Will angrily staring at Rachel.) Oh my God, he’s… Look at the way he’s just staring at me. I think he’s trying to mouth something to me, but I can’t make it out. (Will mouths, “I hate you.”)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, dinner’s ready!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good game!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Solid effort. Solid effort.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, so who won?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Green Bay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Detroit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well the Lions technically won, but it was a moral victory for the Green Bay…Mermen.
(They sit down at the table and Will goes to talk to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Will, right?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I’m Rachel Green.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh I-I remember you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! Aren’t you sweet! I gotta tell you though, I am, I am having the hardest time placing you. Oh-oh hang on! Did we umm, did we fool around at Lance Davis’ graduation party?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: You are unbelievable.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh Rachel? Rachel, why don’t you sit here? (Next to Joey) And Will you sit way over there. (The other side of the table.)
(Monica sets something on the table and removes the cover. It kinda looks like turkey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s it?! Even if nobody helps me I can eat that no problem. At least give me a challenge!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is Chandler’s chicken. This is the turkey. (Sets down a huge turkey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. How-how big is that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: About nineteen pounds.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s like me when I was born.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, who would uh, like some yams? Will?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh, you’d like that wouldn’t ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? (Joey starts offering Ross some turkey.) Oh y’know what? Can we please keep the chicken and the turkey and everything on the other side of the table? The smell is just yuck!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Typical.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. What?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: I said it was typical. Typical of you, Rachel Green, Queen Rachel does whatever she wants in little Rachel land. (Does a fake hair flip.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seriously, who is this guy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, I’m sorry. Do you-do you have a problem with me?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: I don’t know? Do I? Do I?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think you do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Apparently you were umm, a little mean to him in high school.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: A little mean? You made my life miserable!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m-I’m—I had no idea. I’m sorry. I…

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Well you should be. Screw it! Bring on the yams!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Will. But you-you’ve worked so hard…

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yams !!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Chandler grabs the dish from Monica and hands it to Will who starts dishing out a large helping.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh Will umm, I just want to say that I’m real sorry for whatever I-I did to you in high school…

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Oh, it wasn’t just me. We had a club!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You had a club?!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: That’s right, The I Hate Rachel Green Club!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! My God! So what, you all just joined together to hate me?! Who else was in this club?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Me and Ross. (Points at Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No need to point, she knows who Ross is.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, scene continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So you were in an I Hate Rachel club?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yes he was. (Holds up his hand for a high-five.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So who else was in this club?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh actually, there-there was also that exchange student from Thailand but I-I don’t think he-he knew what it was.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Ross, we went out for two years, and you never told me you were in an I Hate Rachel club.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: You went out with her?! We had a pact!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was in high school! It’s not like it was binding forever.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Then why did it have the word eternity in it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Monica, did you know about this?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear I didn’t. (To Ross and Will) Hey! Is that why you guys used to go up to your bedroom and lock the door?

content.speaker: Ross and Will
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm, a little relieved, I gotta say.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Rach I-I’m sorry, okay? I…I was a stupid kid, okay? The only reason I joined…

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Co-founded!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …co-founded. Co-founded the club was because I was insanely in love with you. Obviously I didn’t handle it very well. But if you think about it the I Hate Rachel Club was really the I Love Rachel Club.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Uh, except that it was really the I Hate Rachel Club.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. So what? You guys would just like get together and like just say mean things about me?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Well, we did a little more than that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no! No-no. No-no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! What else did you do?

content.speaker: Will
content.text: We started a rumor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What rumor?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, come on Will! Just take off your shirt and tell us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was no big deal. We-we…said that the rumor was…that umm…you had both…male and female reproductive parts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: That’s right! We said your parents flipped a coin, decided to raise you as a girl, but you still had a hint of a penis.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You started that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! You heard that?! (Goes and stands behind Joey.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Everyone at our school heard it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Everybody at my school heard it! You were the hermaphrodite cheerleader from Long Island?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no!!!! Oh my God!! This is all making so much sense to me now! This is why Adam Carter wouldn’t go out with me! This is why Billy Tratt would just stay in this region! (Motions to her breasts.) (Joey has turned around.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, Billy Tratt is gay now. So-so that one’s not really our fault.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, how come you never told me this?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought it might be true. And I was afraid that you were gonna cry and then show it to me.
(Joey is now looking at Rachel, and since Rachel’s standing and he’s sitting down and he’s not looking at her face… You get the picture.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey stop staring! There’s nothing there! It’s not true!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m afraid I’m gonna need proof.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (Hits him and storms out.)
[Time Lapse, dinner has ended for everyone except Joey who looks like to have finished the turkey, until he turns the plate around and reveals he only ate one side.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You are my Everest.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you don’t have to finish that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yes I do. Otherwise what’s next? Today I’m just a guy who can’t finish a turkey, but tomorrow I’m the guy who eats half a Powerbar , wraps up the rest, and puts in the fridge? No! No, I just…I just—I gotta change my pants. (Gets up and heads for the door.) Jeans have no give. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! Okay! Listen to what Sean McMahon wrote in my yearbook senior year, “Dear Rach, you’re such a good person.” Not girl! Person!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, I think you’re reading a little too much into it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “Dear Rach, you’re a great person. Sorry about your tiney-wienie.” (Will laughs.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to call everyone in the entire school and tell them it wasn’t true?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Could you also tell them I’m skinny now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! Me too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well look-look I’m not calling anybody! Okay? It was like a million years ago!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care how long ago it was! You told people that I was half and half! Y’know what? I just want to point out I never did anything to hurt you in high school.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not totally true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well you-you did start that rumor about Ross making out with Mrs. Altman, our 50-year-old librarian.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: (To Rachel) How did you know that?!!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s true?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes it is! I saw you guys going at it behind the card catalog!
(Ross is at a loss for words.)

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Mrs. Altman? She also made out with Takaka Ci-Kek the night before he went back to Thailand.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry. When you were in high school you made out with a 50-year-old woman?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! She didn’t look 50!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did she look 16?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, there’s a picture of her in the yearbook actually.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (They all look.) Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She didn’t photograph well!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she probably wasn’t familiar with the process having spent most of her life sitting for oil paintings!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how did this happen? Did she, did she lure you to an early bird dinner?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was working late in the library one afternoon. It was just the two of us. She needed some help with her word jumble. And one thing led to another. If you must know, Anita was very gentle and tender. May she rest in peace…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Didn’t she walk with a cane?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Only when it was damp!! (To Rachel) I can’t believe you-you told people about this?! Everybody knew?! Y’know what? (To Will) I’m back in the club!

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Yeah! (They high-five.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I wanna join!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh—Phoebe!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I never got to be in a club. I-I didn’t go to high school, but three of us would meet behind a dumpster to learn French. Bonjour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, y’know—Fine! You guys have your stupid little club, but I would just like to say is what you did to me is way worse than what I did to you! You gave me a tiney-wienie! (Will laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, listen you’re just being silly. Rachel, even with that rumor you were one of the most popular girls in school and everyone wanted to be like you. One girl wanted to be like you so much she stuffed her pants with a Tootsie Roll !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Ross, if it weren’t for Rachel’s rumor I mean no one in high school would even know who you were. She put you on the map!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: As a romancer of the elderly.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Mrs. Altman was the kind of woman you could tell she used to be pretty.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The eyes…did still sparkle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys this stuff is just so way in the past. You-you’ve been through so much since then. And right now you’ve got so much more important stuff going on in your life. Can’t you just let this go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’s right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. I mean we are having a baby together.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Hold on! You got her pregnant?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: Are ya getting married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Will
content.text: So you knocked her up but you’re not gonna marry her. Dude! (Wants another high-five and Ross ignores him.) Anybody?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Goes over and hugs him.) It’s exactly how I’d imagined it would be.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right where’s that turkey!
content.parenthetical: entering, wearing the maternity pants from earlier

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey! Those are my maternity pants!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not now! These are my Thanksgiving pants!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Will has left and the rest of the gang is watching Joey finish the turkey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well that’s it. I’m done. Whew! (Wipes his forehead.) There come the meat sweats. (Chandler hands him a towel and he wipes his face.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well Joey, we’re all…we’re all very proud of you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I believe we can expect a call from the President any moment now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is there anything we can do for you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No just, nobody press on my stomach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You can keep those pants by the way.
(Joey notices Monica has gotten a pie.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa—hey—wh-wh-what do you got there? What is that? Pie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, you want some?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, just cut me a little sliver. (Monica prepares to cut a little sliver.) A little bigger. (Monica prepares to cut a bigger piece.) Little bigger. (Monica moves the knife again.) What?! Are you afraid you’re gonna run out?! Cut me a real piece!
